page.title: 12MAYDAY
page.content: MAYDAY On the first Monday of May the children of the Glasshouses School dance around the maypole on the village green for the people of the village. It starts with a parade from the top of the village with the May Queen, her attendants and all of the children from the school. The children do a selection of the dances which were traditionally danced around a maypole. Ribbons hang down from the top of the pole and each child takes one, so that when the children are dancing patterns are made by the ribbons interweaving on the pole. During the dancing the May- Queen sits on her throne surrounded by her attendants. This event is an annual one which is watched by many people and always enjoyed by everyone.
